alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast and East Central Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Hancock. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Old Town, Ellsworth, Bucksport, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Veazie, Dedham, Kenduskeag, Verona Island, Indian Island, Penobscot Township, Franklin, Glenburn, Orrington, Holden, Milford and Eddington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
